Class TeacherDashboardPage

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
ticktocktrack.gui.TeacherDashboardPage
public class TeacherDashboardPage extends javafx.application.Application
JavaFX Application class representing the Teacher Dashboard UI. Manages the main window, including notifications, user icon, and center content pane.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Starts the Teacher Dashboard application. Stores the primary stage reference and applies the application icon. Checks if a user is logged in; if not, terminates the application.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the main stage (window) provided by JavaFX

    • loadUserIcon

      public void loadUserIcon()
      Loads and sets the current user's profile image into the userIcon ImageView. If the current user has no profile image, sets a default admin user icon.

    • onProfileClicked

      private void onProfileClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the profile icon click event. Opens the UserProfile window and provides a callback to reload the user icon when the user profile is updated.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the profile icon

    • onLogoutClicked

      private void onLogoutClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the logout action when the logout button or icon is clicked. Logs out the current session and navigates back to the home page.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the logout control

    • selectSidebarText

      private void selectSidebarText(javafx.scene.text.Text newSelectedText)
      Updates the sidebar to visually mark the newly selected Text element and reset the previous selection's style.
      Parameters:
      newSelectedText - The Text element to be selected in the sidebar

    • clearSidebarHighlights

      private void clearSidebarHighlights()
      Clears any sidebar text selection highlighting by resetting the color and clearing the selectedText reference.

    • onDashboardClicked

      private void onDashboardClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event when the Dashboard sidebar item is clicked. Updates sidebar selection highlighting and loads the dashboard panel into the center content pane.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the dashboard text

    • onMarkAttendanceClicked

      private void onMarkAttendanceClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event when the Mark Attendance sidebar item is clicked. Updates sidebar selection highlighting and loads the mark attendance panel into the center content pane.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the mark attendance text

    • onViewClassListClicked

      private void onViewClassListClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event when the "View Class List" sidebar item is clicked. Updates sidebar selection highlighting and loads the class list panel for the logged-in teacher into the center content pane.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the "View Class List" text

    • onRegisterClassClicked

      private void onRegisterClassClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event when the "Register Class" sidebar item is clicked. Updates sidebar selection highlighting and prepares the center content pane for loading the class registration panel.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the "Register Class" text

    • onAttendanceSummaryClicked

      private void onAttendanceSummaryClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event when the "Attendance Summary" sidebar item is clicked. Highlights the selected sidebar text and loads the attendance summary panel for the logged-in teacher into the center content pane.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the "Attendance Summary" text

    • onIndividualReportsClicked

      private void onIndividualReportsClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event when the "Individual Reports" sidebar item is clicked. Highlights the selected sidebar text and prepares the center content pane for loading individual report panels.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking the "Individual Reports" text

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method serves as the entry point for the application. It launches the JavaFX application by calling the launch method.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments passed to the program
